newsitem.title: USA: Simon DeBartolo ups stake in mall to 50 pct.
newsitem.headline: Simon DeBartolo ups stake in mall to 50 pct.

text.p: Simon DeBartolo Group Inc said it increased its stake to 50 percent from two percent in West Town Mall, a 1.3 million square foot super-regional mall located in Knoxville, Tenn.
The cost of the acquisition of the 48 percent stake was funded by the issuance of Simon DeBartolo Group LP limited partnership units and cash. The amount was not disclosed.
Simultaneous with this acquisition, an institutional investor represented by CGR Advisors, based in Atlanta, Ga., also increased its ownership in the property to 50 percent.
Simon DeBartolo Group will continue management, leasing and development responsibilities for the mall through its affiliate management company.
Simon DeBartolo Group is a self-administered and self-managed real estate investment trust which owns, develops, manages, leases, acquires and expands regional malls and community shopping centers.
